page.title: 06AYLESTONE MEADOWS (part 1)
page.content: Between the A46 and the A426 lie the{Aylestone Water Meadows.}Through the meadows, along the valley, pass the{River Soar,}the{Grand Union Canal and what was once the{Great Central {Railway.}The old villages of{Aylestone and{Braunstone}(Saxon derived names) are linked across the meadows by {Braunstone Lane,}once called Coalpit Lane, because it was the easiest route for horse-drawn wagons from the West Leicester coal pits. The{"packhorse {bridge"}from the old Coalpit Lane can still be seen in Aylestone. This area is very susceptible to flooding, but has been built-up in places to provide sports facilities for tennis, cricket, rounders and soccer. There is also a riding school, park and childrens play area. This whole area is now mainly used for leisure.
